column4: hello. i'm having a problem mounting a hard drive. i'm working on a friend's computer and trying to recover his data. i boot ubuntu live from a disk and go into the command line. i try 'sudo fdisk -l' and nothing happens. i tried sfdisk as well and still nothing. when i try 'sudo cfdisk -P r' it says "FATAL ERROR: Cannot open disk drive." any idea what the problem is?
If you're trying to recover a failed disk, start by making a bitwise copy of it with ddrescue.  Otherwise you might destroy what's left of the data with your recovery attempts.
and rinkukokiri: it may be that it's just dead. good idea to check for it in the bios. thanks, not sure why i didn't try that first
